channel.title: How do i chnage my port onm a 508 from my source
channel.description: My 474 source is cureently port 43594 & portforwarded also port 5555 is also portforwarded aswell so i do chnage my source on my 508 to port 5555

item.title: How do i chnage my port onm a 508 from my source
item.dc:creator: @wwe_justin wwe justin
item.description:
@wwe_justin wrote:

[quote=“aryan brothr, post:11, topic:314987”]in the source right click the run.bat then change the port to 5555 (should be 43594 now)

in client go to client.java hit Ctrl + F then type 43594 then hit find and then type in 5555[/quote]
my source is already 43594 i wanted to change it to 5555[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 19, 2009, 10:41:20 pm[/size][hr]I coundnt find the port in my client.java in the client and also i coudnt find the GUI on my client

Btw
is it port 5555 or 55555

Read full topic

item.title: How do i chnage my port onm a 508 from my source
item.dc:creator: @aurisdj aurisdj
item.description:
@aurisdj wrote:

oh there i got the :P
umm i think you gotta do this:
go to your client into GUI and search for 43594 and if u find it change it to whatever u want, see i dont code 508’s i code 317’s umm or go to your source into client.java and search 43594 and if u find it change it to whatever u want but if u change it do 55555, sorry if i didint help

item.source: How do i chnage my port onm a 508 from my source

item.title: How do i chnage my port onm a 508 from my source
item.dc:creator: @aryan_brothr aryan brothr
item.description:
@aryan_brothr wrote:

in the source right click the run.bat then change the port to 5555 (should be 43594 now)

in client go to client.java hit Ctrl + F then type 43594 then hit find and then type in 5555

Read full topic

item.title: How do i chnage my port onm a 508 from my source
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.source: How do i chnage my port onm a 508 from my source

item.title: How do i chnage my port onm a 508 from my source
item.dc:creator: @wwe_justin wwe justin
item.description:
@wwe_justin wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:6, topic:314987”]No, he’s not.

Change the port in run.bat

The server.java will read this and start the port on whatever you change it to. However, this means that you need to re-portforward and change the ports in your client. (IP-Changers wont work on anything except 43594)[/quote]

how do i change the ports on the on the client

Read full topic
item.source: How do i chnage my port onm a 508 from my source

item.title: How do i chnage my port onm a 508 from my source
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“123kdd100, post:7, topic:314987”][quote author=hyphy ftw link=topic=411434.msg3034449#msg3034449 date=1258620248]

My 474 source is cureently port 43594 & portforwarded
also port 5555 is also portforwarded aswell
so i do chnage my source on my 508 to port 5555

dumb ass he said a “508” not a 317.
right click on run.bat you’ll find 43594, replace it to whatever you would like it to be

Check in the folder GUI for 43594.
And if its not there check Client.java
[/quote][/quote]
That’s only half of the answer, don’t quote something that isnt complete.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i chnage my port onm a 508 from my source
item.dc:creator: @123kdd100 123kdd100
item.description:
@123kdd100 wrote:

[quote=“hyphy ftw, post:2, topic:314987”][quote author=wwe justin link=topic=411434.msg3034447#msg3034447 date=1258619856]
My 474 source is cureently port 43594 & portforwarded
also port 5555 is also portforwarded aswell
so i do chnage my source on my 508 to port 5555
[/quote]
dumb ass he said a “508” not a 317.
right click on run.bat you’ll find 43594, replace it to whatever you would like it to be

Check in the folder GUI for 43594.
And if its not there check Client.java[/quote]

item.source: How do i chnage my port onm a 508 from my source

item.title: How do i chnage my port onm a 508 from my source
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

No, he’s not.

Change the port in run.bat

The server.java will read this and start the port on whatever you change it to. However, this means that you need to re-portforward and change the ports in your client. (IP-Changers wont work on anything except 43594)

Read full topic
